intro: Cryptosepalum dasycladum, commonly known as the narrow-sepal cryptosepalum, is a rare and unique species of liverwort belonging to the family Cryptosporiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate thallus that is typically green or yellowish in color. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with narrow, elongated sepals and a complex arrangement of reproductive structures. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky crevices or on decaying wood. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
